name: Villa Adele Hotel

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Villa Adele early May and it was nice. It has a very at home feel to it. We were put off by the expensive rates on the actual island and wanted to stay further out. The staff were fantastic, they were really helpful with directions and provided us with great service. The owner even dropped us off at the local station to get the airport bus when we realised we'd miscalculated the time and had missed the bus. My friend also suffered from a swollen leg and they were great in providing us with fresh ice and clean towels.
reviews.title: Staff were friendly, a pleasant stay

reviews.text: I have just returned from my short stay in venice at the villa adele hotel. Accomodation on venice island is very very expensive during peak season;- £90 to £150 per night, so i opted to stay off the island but close enough to a short transport link to the island. I booked this hotel 2 months before i travelled & paid just £24 a night for 4 nights. You probably won't find a cheaper hotel in or around venice. However the villa adele is not ''cheap''. I read the reviews before i booked & most were spot-on. The villa adele is very clean with excellent air-conditioning, the staff very helpful & a transport link to the island just around the corner. The breakfast on offer was cereal, juice, croiccants & yoghurt. The number 6 bus takes you over the motorway crossing to venice isle in 15 minutes. However if i must gripe it would be that the breakfast room is very small. Barely larger than an extended kitchen. Also the mini-bar is empty & you must ask reception if you require water, beer, juice etc.. These were hardly 'problems' as such but the concept of these reviews is to point out your likes & dislikes. This hotel comes recommended to those, like me, on a mid/moderate budget & to all who object to paying £100+ per night on the island. A great find. 8/10.
reviews.title: Great hotel for price, cleanliness & air conditioning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was great. We walked there from the train station (wouldn't recommend that on a hot July afternoon but I think there might have been a bus we could have taken we just were not in the mood to figure that out.) The staff was super nice and helpful. They all spoke excellent English. The room was nice, and comfortable with a beautiful bathroom. Breakfast was crossaint, roll, cereal, fruit ,yogurt, juice, coffee/tea, in a nice dining area. The front desk clerk gave us directions to a restaurant a short walk fromt he hotel and it was wonderful. It was very cool looking inside and had menus available in English as well 4 other languages. The food there was also less expensive than the restaurants in Rome and the portions seemed bigger.
reviews.title: Great and Helpful staff
Great hotel, Excellent staff
reviews.text: It was an easy walk to the bus stop that gets you to San Marco and at the front desk the sell bus tickets and traghetti tickets which is really convenient. I would stay here again in a second.

This hotel was a great welcome to Italy. The staff on reception were great, very knowledgeable and helpful and the room was great. Air-con, clean and a shower with jets! Secure car parking and basic but nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Wonderful home-like stay
Freshly renovated, staff overworked
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in August 2008. We found it difficult to find this hotel, but only because we made the big mistake of not crossing over to the correct side of the tracks at the station. Be warned, there is no other way across if travelling by foot!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was modern and comfortable and came with a massage shower (which unfortunately was a bit of a gimmick and was already slightly broken). Breakfast was interesting. We found we had to wait a very long time to be served coffee. We at first thought we were being ignored because we didn't speak italian, because we didn't even get a good morning and others around us appeared to be getting good service. However we will give them the benefit of the doubt and put it down to staff being overworked! We are pretty sure we saw the same staff working late at night, as in the morning, making it a very long shift! The signs regarding internet usage, food in the rooms, etc. are very abrupt and borderline rude. It was too clear that this business was more about profit than hospitality.
reviews.title: very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel an excellent base to explore Venice and the Veneto. There is a bus stop round the corner with buses heading for Venice stopping frequently. Trip to venice takes c 10min. Also it is only a 5min walk from Mestre train station. The neighbourhood is residential, quiet, and clean. There is a very good pizzeria nearby (Giardinetto). Staff is very friendly and willing to help. Our room was clean, as was the good sized bathroom. A good buffet breakfast is served, though I have seen more abundant ones. Overall highly recommended.
reviews.title: A Good Base

likes.liked: — Good location without the high price of Venice

reviews.text: We stayed at the Villa Adele on a three night break to Venice. The Hotel is in a great location with Mestre railway station only a 10 minute walk away. The trains to Venice run regular and cost 1 euro each way. The trip takes 10 minutes or so. The Villa Adele is classed as a 3 star hotel. In fairness to the place I would personally class the place as a good bed and breakfast establishment serving a continental breakfast.The place is very clean and the staff are extremely helpful. I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again. Our room was quite small with en suite facilities. One word of advice...if the weather is good dont have your bedroom window open or you will suffer at the hands of mosquitos!
reviews.title: Nice little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay here; the rooms and beds were comfy and clean, and the air conditioning worked well. Depending on the staff member, they spoke varying degrees of English but they all tried hard and were very kind. I felt embarassed at my terrible lack of Italian.
reviews.title: Average for a 3 star, but this is Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Villa Adele for 2 nights. One advantage is that one can chat with Hotel staff on skype.So we had all the info when we reached. For visitors from India who are on their own this was great help. If one is traveling by train than should get down at Mestre station . From station it is walking distance if you don't have heavy luggage.Otherwise it is better to take Taxi.We had asked hotel to keep 36 hrs pass which can be used both for Bus to go to Venice( 10 mts. ride) and Waterbus to reach St Marco's square. Otherwise one has to search for pass,and sometimes it is difficult to get one sufficient for duration of your stay.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
a winner - villa adele
reviews.text: Hotel is nice and clean.Good A.C.. Toilet had shower with massage facility. Toilet was chic. Breakfast was OK but filling. Transport to Venice is easy as Bus stop is very close to hotel and Route 6 runs late into night. Surrounding area is quite and pleasant. Ali's Supermarket is just round the corner and all the rooms have fridge.

Staff is just familiar with English except a lady in Morning shift,who doubles as Manger/accountant and is computer savvy.She helped us out with Train timings and other online info. There is no Room Service and evening and night shift is managed by Temp. staff.
reviews.title: Absolutely Great Value and Service with a Smile!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, Great breakfasts & coffee, fantastic, friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for all Budget travelers.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are not your average tourists . We wake early, explore and settle early in the evening, however this didn't bother the hotel, a 05.00 need for a breathe of italian air received a " buon guionorno"- I apologise for my poor italian. The hotel was wonderful. Small but clean & well appointed room. Excellent en suite. Friendly & helpful staff. 5 minutes from the station with a cheap & regular service all over the veneto ( We rate Verona as superb) & 1 euro & 10 mins into Venice. Local buses are also plentiful. Reviews talk of industrial Magerha & Mestre but the area around the hotel is an oasis of residential calm with some town centre shops & restuarants as well. A Great Place to stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great People

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great little hotel just outside of venice.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel !!!
Liked The Hotel Villa Adele
reviews.text: Stayed there only for one night but it was enough to see that rooms are clean and new/renovated, excellent shower (with hydromassage!!!), very welcoming and helpful staff and a private parking for guests.
Hotel is 15-20 minutes from Venice (by bus) and there's a bus station just outside the hotel, train station is also just a few minutes away.
reviews.title: Excellent Value - Nice Location

likes.disliked: — Small shower. But most of them are small in Italy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I had a nice stay at the Hotel Villa Adele. The staff was courteous and pleasant during our stay. The staff helped us with directions around Venice as well as the bus schedule to and from the Grand Canal. They also assisted us with our train schedule concerning our venture from Venice to Rome and the return trip to Venice. They also referred us to some great Italian restaurants. They also pre-arranged our departure from the hotel to Marco Polo Airport. The staff also provided us with clean towels, good food for breakfast and use of the internet. I strongly recommend staying there, especially if you like peace and quiet.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel. OK location, great service.

description: The Hotel Villa Adele located in Venice-Marghera, very close to the motorway Milano-Venezia-Trieste, short walking distance from the railway station Mestre- Venezia, and a few meters to the bus stop number 6 and 6/ to and from the historical center of Venice. The Hotel Villa Adele has 18 rooms (17 double/triple rooms and 1 single room), elegant and informal atmosphere, located in a very quiet position.
